body: @greg0ire has further simplified down the issue to https://psalm.dev/r/53f79d44aa.

Reduced even more: https://psalm.dev/r/e79c2894ec

Must be a flaw in boolean module of Psalm. Which I believe is located in `FormulaGenerator::getFormula`. It's 400 lines of recursive boolean operations. It's gonna be tricky

OK so this is tricky.

```php
($a && $b) || (!$a && $c)
```

is expanded by Psalm to the conjunctive normal form

```php
($a || $c) && (!$a || $b) && ($b || $c)
```

This equivalent (to Psalm) version [demonstrates the same bug](https://psalm.dev/r/76864ff3a5).

But when you enter that CNF into Wolfram Alpha it tells you [the last term is unnecessary](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=%28%21a+%7C%7C+b%29+%26%26+%28a+%7C%7C+c%29+%26%26+%28b+%7C%7C+c%29).

If you remove the unnecessary term [the bug disappears](https://psalm.dev/r/bc5487153d).

The buggy method is `Algebra::combineOredClauses`, but I don't know how to fix it — `combineOredClauses` is a pretty simple method that just applies the standard distributed method for converting DNF to CNF. Then it looks like `Algebra::negateFormula` has incorrect behaviour when passed a formula with unnecessary terms, but I don't think _that_ is a bug — `negateFormula` expects an optimal CNF.

I don't, honestly, remember how to obviously get the DNF to CNF conversion correct (missing the unnecessary term) on paper — once that was correct, fixing the `combineOredClauses` method wouldn't be too difficult. Either way the solution would probably slow down `combineOredClauses`.

issue.title: Logical OR leads to TypeDoesNotContainType

labels.name: hard problems
labels.description: Problems without an obvious easy solution

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
https://psalm.dev/r/2b0bbc6018
```
ERROR: TypeDoesNotContainType - 21:6 - Type ""|"0"|null for $email is always falsy
```
But if I split it into several ifs, Psalm gets it without issues:
https://psalm.dev/r/c8564dd6d9

You can see this works:
https://3v4l.org/era8I

body:
Another example:

These two are functionally similar but give different output: https://psalm.dev/r/8f6b691a68

The solution is for me to add a rule to reduce the specific pattern

```
(A || <set of orred terms X>)
    && (!A || <set of orred terms Y>)
    && (<set of orred terms X> || <set of orred terms Y>)
```
to
```
(A || <set of orred terms X>)
    && (!A || <set of orred terms Y>)
```

i.e. when we have two clauses that negate a term within one another and another clause that's just the two uncontradicted terms together that clause is redundant. Should be a reasonably simple rule to add.

issue.title: Fix #6683 by improving simplification of CNF

labels.name: release:fix
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Fixes' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

body: This is fixed on Psalm 5! Thanks Matt!
